paper_abstract: We present and study a probabilistic neural automaton in which the fraction of simultaneously-updated neurons is a parameter, rho epsilon (0, 1). For small rho, there is relaxation towards one of the attractors and a great sensibility to external stimuli and, for rho >= rho(c,) itinerancy among attractors. Tuning rho in this regime, oscillations may abruptly change from regular to chaotic and vice versa, which allows one to control the efficiency of the searching process. We argue on the similarity of the model behavior with recent observations, and on the possible role of chaos in neurobiology. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Instabilities in attractor networks with fast synaptic fluctuations and partial updating of the neurons activity
